content:
• Friday, February 24, 2017
  • AMCX

    Loop Capital: AMC Networks needs follow-up to 'Walking Dead'

    • Nothing lasts forever, not even the undead legions populating AMC (AMCX +1.9%) TV show The Walking Dead -- now a little long in the tooth in terms of ratings.
    • The show provided a prequel series, Fear the Walking Dead, but the network needs a third "owned" hit for the sake of the stock, says Loop Capital's David Miller.
    • He has a Hold rating on AMC Networks and bumped his price target to $56 from $54, implying 8% downside from today's price.
    • While The Walking Dead still does well in the key youth demographic, it's flagging, and AMC needs another marquee hit to keep its run going, Miller argues.
    • “Yes, AMCX currently owns original series Turn; Humans; and Into the Badlands, but those three series, while garnering much critical acclaim, have proven to be too 'culty,' and have not proven to be catalysts for the stock,” Miller says. And network hit Better Call Saul is actually owned by Sony.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • WIN

    Windstream shareholders approve merger with EarthLink

    • At a special meeting today, Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) stockholders approved steps required for the company's acquisition of EarthLink Holdings (ELNK -3.8%).
    • By an overwhelming margin, stockholders signed off on the issuance of shares of common stock to EarthLink shareholders in the all-stock deal as well as increasing the authorized-share count to 375M shares (by 96% and 95.4% margins respectively).
    • With that business done, Windstream anticipates closing the deal as soon as Monday before Nasdaq opens trading.
    • After hours: WIN -3.2%; ELNK +3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM | 1 Comment

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: STM +3.8%. CEMP +3.7%. ELNK +3.5%. PVG +2.9%. MUX +2.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: WIN -2.6%. HBM -2.2%. CNDT -2.0%. CBPX -1.8%. TV -1.7%.

  • Cohn's border tax statement clarified

    • Gary Cohn's negative comments about a border tax were in specific reference to the current House language, but he doesn't object to the concept, reports Axios's Dan Primack (Axios broke the original story).
    • Previously: Retail stocks jolted once again by border tax talk (Feb. 24)
    • ETFs: XLP, XLY, VDC, XRT, VCR, RTH, RETL, FXG, IYK, FXD, IYC, RHS, FDIS, FSTA, SCC, RCD, UCC, PMR, UGE, SZK, CNDF, CNSF, FTXD, JHMC, JHMS
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 18 Comments
  • FIX

    Comfort Systems USA announces acquisition; Shares +15%

    • Comfort Systems USA (NYSE:FIX) announced that it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire the BCH Holdings family of companies headquartered in Tampa, Florida. Terms were undisclosed and transaction is expected to close on or about April 1, 2017.
    • Initially BCH is expected to contribute annualized revenues of ~$100 - $110M at profitability levels that are generally equal to or above those currently experienced by existing Comfort Systems USA operations. The acquisition is expected to make a neutral to slightly accretive contribution to EPS during the first 12 to 18 months post acquisition.
    • CEO Brian Lane: "We are extremely happy to announce that BCH and its extraordinary team of professionals will be joining Comfort Systems USA. BCH has a fantastic reputation and consistent track record of providing extraordinary outcomes for its customers in industrial, medical and commercial markets.”
    • Shares +15% at $38.05
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • SPKE

    Report: Spark Energy set to go up for sale

    • Spark Energy (SPKE +7.4%) has spiked higher on heavy volume in afternoon trading after SparkSpread reported the company had retained Morgan Stanley to advise on a possible sale of the company.
    • Shares are susceptible to short induced swings, as short interest totals 43% of the float.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk coverage widely positive post-Q4 2017 earnings, guide of Q1 revenue below expectations

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK), trading at a 3.2% reduction nearing the end of the week given issuance of Q1 revenue outlook of $231M-$233M compared to consensus $241.42M, remains nevertheless under favorable observation at Drexel Hamilton (Buy, target from $90 to $93), Oppenheimer & Co. (Outperform, $80), Jefferies (Buy, $81), Pacific Crest Securities (Overweight, $67) and Cowen and Company (Outperform, $67) [current price $62.80].
    • An overly conservative guide, reflecting the "throes of seasonality" (Drexel Hamilton analyst Brian White), is generally noted.
    • Yesterday (February 23, 2017): Splunk -7.7%; Q4 2017 over expectations, Q1 revenue outlook light
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGHT

    Comms firm 8x8 jumps 9% on report it's exploring sale with bankers

    • Comms firm 8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT) has vaulted 9% on reports that it's exploring a sale.
    • The company is reportedly working with Morgan Stanley to explore the prospect. Reuters cites sources who say 8x8 could sell to another firm or to private equity.
    • Market cap for 8x8 is now just about $1.45B.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • GTLS

    Chart Industries upgraded to Buy at Lake Street

    • Chart Industries (GTLS +6.4%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $44 price target, raised from $32, at Lake Street, which says the company is starting to see signs of a recovery in demand that likely will drive operating margin expansion and an increase in backlog starting in mid-2017.
    • In yesterday's earnings conference call, GTLS noted a significant increase in customer interest and a plan to increase capacity at its La Crosse, Wis., brazed-aluminum heat exchanger facility in anticipation of demand growth in 2018.
    • Backlog declined in Q4 and management changes weighed on shares yesterday, but the firm thinks GTLS is in the early stages of an up-cycle that can move shares higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • PEI

    PREIT down 5.9% on soft guidance

    • Q4 adjusted FFO of $0.57 per share vs. $0.60 one year earlier. Backing out assets sold during 2016, and adjusted FFO of $0.57 rose from $0.53 in the year-ago period.
    • Full-year 2017 FFO per share is guided to $1.64-$1.74 vs. $1.89 earned in 2016. Street consensus is for $1.78. Guidance assumes same-store NOI growth of 1-2%.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Previously: Pennsylvania REIT beats by $0.03, beats on Base rent (Feb. 23)
    • PEI -5.9%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: AAOI +26%. OLED +19%. PDVW +10%. APDN +9%. ENPH +9%.
    • Losers: OTC:FNCX -23%. ACIA -15%. OTCPK:RNVA -11%. LFGR -11%. ATNI -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • AU

    AngloGold -10% for the week as CEO sold shares

    • AngloGold Ashanti (AU -2.5%) extends its losses for the week to 10% despite resuming a dividend for the first time in three years, and Dimitra DeFotis at Barron's suggests one reason for the performance divergence could be a share sale by the CEO.
    • This week, Srinivasan Venkatakrishnan disclosed the sale of some recently vested shares acquired through a profit-sharing program; the CEO said he needed to make the sale to cover a related tax liability.
    • The sale involved ~12.9K shares purchased by the company for nearly 2M rand ($154,720) in shares on behalf of the CEO as part of the plan, which was followed by a sale of 5,367 shares valued at ~836.2K rand ($64,695) to settle tax costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 7 Comments
  • HUSKF

    Reuters: Husky Energy weighs selling some eastern Canadian assets

    • Husky Energy (OTCPK:HUSKF -2.3%) is considering trimming stakes in some of its eastern Canadian offshore assets, in a move that could fetch as much as several billion dollars, Reuters reports.
    • Husky finds the assets less attractive in a low oil price environment, making it challenging to generate profits, according to the report, which also says the company could invest the sale proceeds in South America, Africa or Asia.
    • When asked about the potential sale during today's earnings call, CEO Rob Peabody said Husky's Atlantic operations were an important part of its portfolio and declined to comment on what he said was speculation.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • CMLS

    Cumulus Media -25% as judge rejects debt refinancing plans

    • Cumulus Media (NASDAQ:CMLS) is now down 25% and stabilizing a bit after a sudden midday drop following a judge's rejection of the company's refinancing plan.
    • U.S. District Judge Katherine Polk Failla rejected the company's plan to rework $2.4B in debt, which was opposed by some lenders.
    • Cumulus had filed a suit accusing JPMorgan Chase of withholding consent to parts of the plan.
    • The company's market cap is down to $23.5M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • INTU

    Intuit upgraded to Outperform at Credit Suisse

    • From Neutral, analyst Michael Nemeroff notes ongoing small business segment growth, an expected standard close to the 2016 tax season and prospective increase in valuation appeal should U.S. tax reform pass prior to the end of the current year given concentration of revenues within the country.
    • Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) price target from $109 to $140 (current price $127, +5.22%).
    • Earlier (February 24, 2017): Intuit +5.45%; Q2 2017 in line, FY outlook reissued
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: SGY +8%. SSRI +6%. ROYT +6%.
    • Losers: BPT -16%. EMES -15%. CRK -13%. GIFI -13%. HCLP -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • FCH

    Ashford Trust -12% after earnings miss

    • Q4 adjusted FFO of $18M or $0.16 per share vs. $30.9M and $0.27 one year ago. Expectations were for $0.22.
    • Comparable RevPAR for hotels not under renovation of 3.2%; hotel EBITDA margin up 46 basis points.
    • FelCor Lodging (FCH -6.8%) acquisition proposal.
    • Previously: Ashford Hospitality Trust misses by $0.06, misses on revenue (Feb. 23)
    • AHT -11.95%
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 9 Comments
  • CMLS

    Cumulus Media -20% into penny territory

    • Cumulus Media (NASDAQ:CMLS) has taken a sudden fall into sub-$1 territory, dropping 20% this hour to $0.80/share.
    • The move's on no immediate news. Volume has spiked to well above average, however, with more than 226,000 shares traded against an average of 127,200.
    • Most recently, the company has given multiple extensions to a private debt exchange offer for its 7.75% senior notes due 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAC

    Banks give some back as rates sink to 2017 low

    • The 10-year Treasury yield is off another four basis points today to 2.33% - now at the bottom of a range of about 2.3%-2.6% that it's occupied since shortly after the election.
    • Financial sector investors betting on higher interest rates may be keeping a close eye on whether or not a downside breakout occurs.
    • For now, satiated bulls are cashing in a few chips, with the XLF -0.9%, the KRE -1.15%, and KBE -1.05% vs. the S&P 500's 0.15% decline.
    • Bank of America (BAC -1.9%), JPMorgan (JPM -1.2%), Morgan Stanley (MS -2.4%), Regions Financial (RF -1.3%), KeyCorp (KEY -1.5%), Fifth Third (FITB -1.1%), State Street (STT -1.2%), Schwab (SCHW -0.9%), MetLife (MET -1.6%), Lincoln National (LNC -1.4%)
    • ETFs: XLF, FAS, FAZ, UYG, VFH, IYF, BTO, IYG, FNCL, SEF, FXO, RYF, FINU, RWW, XLFS, FINZ, JHMF, FAZZ, FNCF
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 18 Comments
  • TDS

    Telephone & Data Systems -7.4% as wireless drags on results

    • Telephone & Data Systems (NYSE:TDS) is 7.4% lower after Q4 earnings held back by mobile results where subs fell and losses grew.
    • Results again heavily reflected those at U.S. Cellular (NYSE:USM), of which TDS holds a heavy majority. As with USM, net loss widened at TDS, to $5M from a year-ago loss of $1M.
    • Aside from the prepaid gains and postpaid declines in customers at U.S. Cellular, the TDS Telecom unit saw another increase in wireline residential connections, to 585,400 from 582,700. Voice connections dropped to 310,600 from 319.800; broadband connections rose to 229,500 from 228,500; and IPTV subs rose to 45,300 from 34,400. Residential revenue per connection rose to $44.27 from $41.24.
    • In commercial connections, wireline fell to 329,700 from 341,000. Voice connections dropped to 157,400 from 171,500; broadband dipped to 21,400 from 22,400; and managedIP grew to 150,900 from 147,100.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CEMP +34%. AAOI +30%. RH +29%. OLED +20%. ZSAN +19%. IPCI +18%. EHTH +15%. FIX +13%. WMAR +13%. BBW +13%.
    • Losers: NAO -39%. OTC:FNCX -24%. BPT -21%. CMLS -17%. GIFI -16%. ARL -14%. ACIA -13%. NVFY -12%. EMES -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • USM

    U.S. Cellular -6.5% as loss widens, subscribers shrink

    • U.S. Cellular (NYSE:USM) has tumbled 6.5% after posting Q4 earnings that featured a wider loss and revenues that missed expectations after growing just fractionally.
    • Net postpaid subs declined again, by 2,000, bringing the total to 4.482M. Net prepaid adds of 4,000 brought that customer base to 484,000.
    • Revenue breakout: Service, $737M (down 8%); Equipment sales, $254M (up 37%).
    • Postpaid ARPU was $45.19, down from the prior year's $51.46 as well as last quarter's $47.08. Prepaid ARPU fell to $33.25 from a year-ago $35.54 and last quarter's $34.39.
    • For 2017, it's guiding to total revenues of $3.8B-$4B (below expectations for $4.05B), operating cash flow of $500M-$650M, EBITDA of $650M-$800M (above consensus for $628.5M) and capex of about $500M.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • INCY

    Incyte to join S&P 500 next week; shares ahead 6%

    • Money flow into Incyte (INCY +5.9%) is ramping up evidenced by a 4x surge in volume. The company will join the S&P 500 on Tuesday, February 28 replacing Spectra Energy (SE).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 11 Comments
  • NSU

    Nevsun Resources -8% on earnings disappointment, big dividend cut

    • Nevsun Resources (NSU -8.2%) plunges after reporting lower than expected FY 2016 earnings and cuts its quarterly dividend rate to $0.01/share from $0.04.
    • NSU says it will redeploy $120M over four years from its dividend toward development of the Timok high-grade copper-gold project in Serbia, believing the development of the Timok Upper Zone represents the company's best allocation of capital.
    • NSU expects to invest $45M in the Timok Upper Zone project during 2017, and says the pre-feasibility study remains on budget and on time for delivery in September 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 23 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: VUZI +10%. FL +8%. NUS +5%.
    • Losers: NVFY -9%. KBSF -9%. VNCE -7%. SPAR -7%. XNY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • INTU

    Intuit +5.45%; Q2 2017 in line, FY outlook reissued

    • Q2 2017 results – revenue $1.01B (+9.4% Y/Y, in line), EPS $0.26 ($0.01 above estimates), operating income $106M (-7% Y/Y), QuickBooks Online subscribers 1.87M (+49%)
    • Q3 2017 projections – revenue $2.5B-$2.55B (+9%-11%; consensus $2.44B), EPS $3.85-$3.90 (consensus $3.89), operating income $1.5B-$1.52B, QuickBooks Online subscribers 2M
    • FY 2017 projections (reiterated) – revenue $5B-$5.1B (+7%-9%; consensus $5.06B), EPS $4.30-$4.40 (+14%-16%; consensus $4.34), operating income $1.675B-$1.725B (+8%-11%), QuickBooks Online subscribers 2.2M
    • Intuit chairman and CEO Brad Smith: "We continue to be pleased with how our long-term strategy in Small Business is playing out, driving momentum for the QuickBooks Online ecosystem. Our Small Business results are bolstered by product and platform innovation, improved product market fit outside of the U.S., and further expansion of our addressable market by targeting the self-employed segment. We are also in the midst of another highly competitive tax season. While the industry came out of the gates a bit slow, we are confident we have a strong and winning hand that combines innovation across the end-to-end experience, an effective marketing campaign, and great value for taxpayers. Experience tells us that every tax season is different, but there’s one thing we know for certain about the tax business: everyone needs to file by the April 18 deadline."
    • Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) 127.28.
    • Press release / earnings call transcript / 10-Q
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • NWL

    Newell Brands pops more than 2% during conference presentation

    • The presentation slides for the CAGNY Conference show reaffirmed full-year 2017 guidance for core sales growth of 2.5-4%, and normalized EPS of $2.95-$3.15.
    • The company is also targeting $1B in cost synergies by 2021, with Phase 1 (by Q3 2018) savings of $500M, and Phase 2 - another $500 - after that.
    • Down in early trading, NWL is now higher by 2.25%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy upgraded at UBS, maintained Buy at Wunderlich

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.8%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell with a $6 price target at UBS, citing valuation and the company's improved liquidity position.
    • UBS notes CHK's H2 2017 weighted completion schedule with 130-160 wells per quarter, consistent with its 2017 growth trajectory; expectations to run 17 rigs, a level it expects to maintain this year; and proved reserves rising by 14% Y/Y to 10.2B cfe, replacing ~267% of production.
    • Also, Wunderlich maintains its Buy rating and $10 price target, saying CHK is “close to growing production again while well results and asset sales could provide value-added catalysts.”
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 21 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: CEMP +36%. ZSAN +26%. IPCI +22%. BLPH +16%. CLSD +13%.
    • Losers: EYEG -11%. PTX -10%. SNGX -9%. MBRX -8%. NK -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • NVDA

    Mobileye -3%, Nvidia +4% intraday; Citron Research closing Nvidia short position, transferring to Mobileye

    • Firm notes Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) trade closer (sub-$100 earlier aided by Instinet, BMO Capital Markets downgrades issued this week) to prior-issued $90 target.
    • Shifts position to Mobileye (NYSE:MBLY), particularly spotlighting $250M+ of insider sales since January 2016. Sets $35 short-term target (current price $46.74).
    • Previously (December 28, 2016): Citron Research cautious on Nvidia, projects return to $90
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 31 Comments
  • RWT

    Redwood Trust -4% after earnings miss

    • A fancy valuation and an earnings miss don't make for a good combination for Redwood Trust (RWT -4.1%) this morning. The company last night reported Q4 core earnings of $27M or $0.33 per share vs. $33M and $0.39 earned in Q3. Expectations had been for $0.38. Dividend is $0.28.
    • GAAP book value per share of $14.96 at year-end vs. $14.74 three months earlier. With today's decline, the stock trades at $16.31. The stock is still higher by about 50% Y/Y.
    • Quarterly Redwood Review: Company continues to expect to generate GAAP earnings in excess of recent annual dividends of $1.12 per share, but the nature of the business means a "lumpy" pace of capital deployment that doesn't always align well with quarterly reports.
    • Previously: Redwood Trust misses by $0.05, misses on net interest income (Feb. 23)
    • Previously: Redwood Trust declares $0.28 dividend (Feb. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • SATS

    EchoStar +2.2% as core profitability rises in Q4

    • EchoStar (NASDAQ:SATS) is up 2.2% after mixed results in its Q4 earnings showed revenue declines in but an increase in underlying profitability.
    • Revenue fell 6.3% and missed expectations, but EBITDA rose 2.8% to $229.1M, beating an expected $217M, driven by gains at Hughes and EchoStar Technologies that offset a drop in satellite services.
    • Cash and equivalents were at $3.09B as of Dec. 31.
    • Revenue by segment: Hughes, $370.9M (up 6.8%); EchoStar Technologies Corp., $266.1M (down 18.2%); EchoStar Satellite Services, $101.7M (down 12.5%); other, $1.66M (down 18.5%).
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • HPE

    Hewlett Packard Enterprise downgraded at BMO Capital Markets, Needham & Company

    • Post-earnings, analyst Tim Long (BMO Capital Markets) considers factors contributing to light results and outlook potentially continuing for multiple quarters, with shares remaining range-bound in the process. Further: "Outside of the divestitures, there are no meaningful catalysts on the horizon, and while that and low valuation could provide support for the shares, there is also not much upside." Price target from $27 to $24, rating from Outperform to Market Perform.
    • Analyst Richard Kugele (Needham & Company), downgrading from Buy to Hold, notes "little reason" to continue recommending, suggesting greater upside is to be found in Nimble Storage, Nutanix and Pure Storage.
    • Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE) $22.58, -8.45%.
    • Yesterday (February 23, 2017): Hewlett Packard Enterprise -6.5%; Q1 2017 revenue, outlook off
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 7 Comments

  • New home sales disappoint; 10-year Treasury yield touches 2017 low

    • New home sales rose to a seasonally adjusted annualized rate of 555K in January, rebounding from December's 7% decline, but shy of expectations for 576K.
    • On a year-over basis, new homes sales in January were higher by 5.5%.
    • Full report
    • The homebuilder ETFs (ITB, XHB) are down slightly more than the S&P 500's 0.3% decline.
    • Ten-year Treasury prices continue their mini-rally, with the yield falling four basis points today to a 2017-low of 2.33%. We won't call it a bull market just yet - for now, we'll say the yield is at the bottom end of what's been a 2.3-2.6% range over the weeks since the election. TLT +0.75%, TBT -1.5%
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, VGLT, TLH, UBT, DLBS, TLO, VUSTX, DLBL, TYBS
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney -10% as sluggish sales trend continues

    • J.C. Penney (JCP -9.5%) execs noted during today's earnings call that a higher level of promotions cut into Q4 margins.
    • Looking ahead, a leaner J.C. Penney plans a stronger focus on Sephora, footwear, swimwear and plus-sized apparel this year.
    • Shares of JCP sunk to a 52-week low of $6.18 this morning after the earnings release.
    • Previously: J.C. Penney improves profitability, store closings on tap (Feb. 24)
    • Previously: J.C. Penney beats by $0.03, misses on revenue (Feb. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 13 Comments
  • BASFY

    BASF weighed by cautious 2017 outlook; says Iran talks in limbo

    • BASF (OTCQX:BASFY -2.7%) is sharply lower after higher petrochemical prices helped more than double Q4 profits but the company outlined disappointing guidance for FY 2017.
    • BASF says it is targeting a gain in operating profit before one-offs of 1%-10% in 2017 after a 6% decline last year, but investors had hoped for an increase in operating profit of at least 12%, sending shares lower on the DAX index and wiping out gains made over the last two weeks.
    • In today's earnings conference call, BASF CEO Kurt Bock said the company is in talks with Iran over a possible investment of its oil and gas division in the country but any decision is in limbo due to uncertainty over the status of economic sanctions.
    • Bock also said he saw no need for BASF to pursue any "transformational" takeover deals, even as peers Bayer and Monsanto as well as Dow and DuPont are merging.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • RMGN

    RMG Networks continues big run on sales order

    • The customer is a $10B global manufacturing company with 50 facilities world-wide. It initially implemented a pilot of RMG's (RMGN +12.3%) Visual Supply Chain solution in mid-2016 to help streamline operations.
    • The success led to a secondary project awarded late last year for more than $250K.
    • One bull reminds the company in December completed an insider-backstopped rights offering, giving it the capital to pursue growth.
    • RMG reports its Q4 on March 4, and will present at the Roth Conference later that month.
    • With today's move, the stock's up more than 50% in 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • ACIA

    Acacia Communications targets broadly reduced, generally reiterated positively

    • With Acacia Communications' Q1 2017 guidance (revenue $108M-$114M vs. consensus $137.36M, EPS $0.63-$0.70 vs. consensus $0.78) primarily impacting shares to 16% declines, Morgan Stanley, Needham & Company and Cowen and Company reissue associated Overweight/Buy/Outperform ratings while lowering targets from $80 to $70, $125 to $100 and $115 to $75, respectively. Goldman Sachs, reiterating at Neutral, lowers from $80 to $69.
    • Acacia Communications, on its earnings call (transcript), attributed a lower-than-expected rate of orders from a major customer with exposure to the DCI market (William Blair, J.P. Morgan observe as ADVA Optical Networking) to the guidance calculation, with that customer indicating unpredictable demand among cloud and content provider clients.
    • Acacia Communications (NASDAQ:ACIA) $53.28.
    • Yesterday (February 23, 2017): Acacia Communications -17.6%; Q4 2016 above expectations, Q1 outlook at issue
    • Earlier (February 24, 2017): Opticals noted post-Applied Optoelectronics, Acacia Communications reporting
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 13 Comments
  • ATUSF

    Fairfax to make up to C$100M investment in Altius Minerals

    • Altius Minerals (OTCPK:ATUSF +5.4%) surges at the open after Fairfax Financial agrees to make a strategic investment of as much as C$100M in the company in exchange for issuance of preferred securities and warrants.
    • Altius says the proceeds will be used to invest in opportunities it identifies within the mining and minerals sector, and for general corporate purposes.
    • Fairfax will have the right to nominate one director to Altius' board.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • HRTX

    Heron's SUSTOL included in cancer clinical practice guidelines; shares up 7%

    • Heron Therapeutics (HRTX +7.3%) bucks the market's sour mood on light volume. This morning, it announced that SUSTOL ( granisetron) extended-release injection is now included in the National Comprehensive Cancer Network's Clinical Practice Guidelines in Oncology for Antiemesis Version 1.2017.
    • SUSTOL has a Category 1 recommendation which reflects the highest level of evidence and consensus for its use in the prevention of acute and delayed chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV).   • EARS

    Auris Medical's AM-111 Fast Track'd in U.S. for inner ear hearing loss; shares up 13% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Auris Medical Holding AG (NASDAQ:EARS) perks up 13% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has granted Fast Track status for AM-111 for the treatment of acute sensorineural (inner ear) hearing loss.
    • Fast Track status provides for more frequent interactions with the FDA review team and a rolling review of the NDA. AM-111 is currently in Phase 3 development.
    • AM-111 is a biodegradable gel that is administered in a single-dose intratympanic injection into the middle ear. From there, the drug diffuses through the round window membrane into the cochlea. Its active ingredient is a synthetic peptide called D-JNK-1 that inhibits the JNK stress kinase which is activated following stress to the inner ear. Blocking JNK protects stress-injured cochlear cells and helps to prevent/reduce hearing loss.

  • CEMP

    Cempra's CEM-102 successful in late-stage ABSSSI study; shares ahead 49% premarket

    • Cempra (NASDAQ:CEMP) is up 49% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a 716-subject Phase 3 clinical trial assessing CEM-102 (fusidic acid) for the treatment of acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections ((ABSSSI)).
    • The study met its primary of endpoint of demonstrating non-inferiority to oral linezolid (Pfizer's Zyvox) as measured by the proportion of patients achieving early clinical response (ECR). ECR was defined by at least a 20% reduction from baseline in lesion size 48 -72 hours after starting treatment without the receipt of additional non-study antibiotic therapy.
    • In the intent-to-treat population, 87.2% (n=313/359) of patients receiving fusidic acid showed ECR compared to 86.6% (n=309/357) for linezolid. The clinical success rates at the end of treatment were 91.9% and 89.6%, respectively.
    • CEM-102, branded as TAKSTA, has Qualified Infectious Disease Product (QIDP) status in the U.S. which provides for accelerated review of the marketing application and an additional five-year period of market exclusivity, if approved. TAKSTA's active ingredient, sodium fusidate, is the sodium salt of fusidic acid, an antibiotic that has been in use since 1962.
    • The complete data will be submitted for presentation at a future scientific conference.
    • The company plans to meet with the FDA to clarity the regulatory path to approval.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM | 240 Comments

  • AXDX

    FDA OKs Accelerate Diagnostics' automated blood culture system and test kit; shares up 24% premarket

    • Thinly traded Accelerate Diagnostics (NASDAQ:AXDX) is up 24% premarket, albeit on only 100 shares, in response to its announcement that the FDA has granted its de novo request to market its automated Accelerate Pheno system and Accelerate PhenoTest BC kit for the identification and antibiotic susceptibility testing of pathogens directly from positive blood culture samples.
    • The company says PhenoTest can generate a result in ~8 hours which is ~40 hours less than traditional culture-based identification and susceptibility systems that are performed manually.
    • A 510(k) submission, less rigorous than a full PMA, requires the sponsor to show equivalence to an already-approved product. A de novo submission just means that the product is novel, with no predicate devices on the market.
    • Management will host a conference call on Monday, February 27 at 4:15 pm ET to discuss the de novo request and preliminary earnings.
    • Previously: Accelerate Diagnostics closing in on regulatory application for Pheno system; shares up 17% (June 15, 2016)
